abstract: But that movie, starring Hugh Jackman, will need to continue drawing large audiences to justify its hefty production budget of $110 million and tens of millions more in marketing support.
snippet: But that movie, starring Hugh Jackman, will need to continue drawing large audiences to justify its hefty production budget of $110 million and tens of millions more in marketing support.
lead_paragraph: Boxing robots were No. 1 at the North American box office over the weekend, as "Real Steel" (DreamWorks Studios/Disney) sold an estimated $27.3 million in tickets. That total was solid, but the picture, which stars Hugh Jackman as a reluctant father, will need to continue drawing large audiences to justify its hefty production budget of $110 million and tens of millions more in marketing support. Many critics disliked "Real Steel," but audiences, especially younger moviegoers, gave it strong marks in exit polls.

headline.main: 'Real Steel' Is No. 1 at the Weekend Box Office
